attributes.action: Stop Landlords from discriminating against individuals who claim housing benefit
attributes.background: As housing prices are rising, people are finding it harder to put put a roof over their heads. Many families facing financial difficulties are being turned away from renting simply because they claim housing benefit. As long as the landlord gets their money what is the problem?

attributes.action: Add a BH on the 1st/2nd Mon of Nov as a perpetual reminder celebrating WW1 & WW2
attributes.background: In 2018, it will be the 100th Anniversary of the end of WW1. We currently commemorate both WW1 & WW2 by having some form of ceremony on the 11th November each year. Let's change that from a ceremony into a Bank Holiday on the 1st or 2nd Monday of November as a perpetual reminder.

attributes.action: Help for separated parents to get back on the property ladder
attributes.background: Especially when the 'other half' is legally entitled to the existing property (if children are involved) and the person who has to leave, finds it difficult to start again and fund a new purchase (especially when older, 40+) with deposit, stamp duty and a limited mortgage term due to age.

attributes.action: Food tolerance testing on the NHS
attributes.background: Ive lived for years with severe IBS in and out of hospital,  test after test with no light at the end of the tunel to why im in pain 24hours a day 7 days a week.
attributes.additional_details: Ive lived for years with severe IBS in and out of hospital,  test after test with no light at the end of the tunel to why im in pain 24hours a day 7 days a week. This is costing the NHS millions every year treating people with drugs and tests when it can all be done with a simple food tolerance test that the NHS do not supply.  sign this petition to get this service put on the NHS to help 1000 of people each year lead a pain free life.

attributes.action: Call for legal representation for all children detained by the police at school
attributes.background: Currently innocent children unaware of their legal rights can be secretly detained and questioned by the police and social workers at their school without parents. Any questioning by the police should be done at a police station in the presence of a legal representative for the child, not at school.
attributes.additional_details: Call for the government to debate that schools should be a place of learning not for children to be detained and questioned. The relationship between children, parents and the school should only relate to education and schools should be a place of opportunity for children to develop their personality and talents and prepare for responsibility in life. Schools should be neutral and not police detention centres.  The Rights of children must be protected at school and not to have their rights abused

attributes.action: Abolish the use of whole life sentences in England and Wales
attributes.background: Whole life sentences mean that a prisoner is effectively condemned to stay in prison until they die. There are about 8,000 prisoners serving life sentences in England and Wales, and at least 60 of those are serving whole life sentences.
attributes.additional_details: Nobody can predict when a prisoner will die, and in many cases they will reach an age where they will be no threat to society. And it has been proven in the past that even some of the worst criminals can rehabilitate and therefore qualify for parole. And what incentive do they have to behave in prison if they have no realistic hope of parole? Several such prisoners have behaved very violently in prison,  injuring other inmates, and one even committed further killings in prison.

attributes.action: National Volunteer Service. (NVS)
attributes.background: In the old days we had a national service where two years were spent training and preparing for war as apart of our public service, instead of destroying the world with our hands, we can build and heal the world by volunteering at home or abroad.
attributes.additional_details:
The idea is to get youth involved in aid, charity, sustainable development and homelessness programmes. A mandatory year is spent in volunteering after compulsory education. This would be an excellent opportunity for youth to gain work experience, a work ethic, employment opportunities, to character build and have fun.

This was inspired through the work undertaken by being a volunteer in the Raleigh ICS programme.

attributes.action: Allow Councils to decide the amount of Hunting they want to allow.
attributes.background: The Hunting Act of 2004 and the Protection of Wild Mammals Act (Scotland) of 2002, ban the Hunting of wild mammals with dogs. There are arguments for and against this bill, but there is a large amount of people who want it repealed and a large amount of people who want it strengthened.
attributes.additional_details: Why not allow local councils to vote whether to keep the ban as it, weaken it slightly, strengthen it, or outright repeal it, this would be a way for local democracy in this country to help those who feel passionately on both sides. This could allow councils in rural areas that are against the ban, to show this and would allow councils in areas where people are passionately for the ban to strengthen the ban to levels they find acceptable?

attributes.action: Urgently Review current legislation on Oil&Gas developments near major Airports.
attributes.background:
With the news out recently regarding Horse Hill and the flow testing of their well of which has produced flows of conventional oil, it's apparent that the legislation needs to be reviewed urgently.
This well is just over a mile from Gatwick airport and clearly this is a concern if it was developed.
attributes.additional_details: Listed companies that are investors in HorseHill developments Ltd the licence holder of the well, have recently realised RNS's confirming flow rates of Oil and clearly this projects is likely to be developed over time and the current laws and regs do not reflect this advancement and their are concerns regarding safety considering this well and any future (possibly hundreds) wells are within a very short distance from a major airport (gatwick) oil storage tanks and airplanes don't mix.

attributes.action: Ban publicly accountable bodies from buying through 'middlemen' companies.
attributes.background: public sector buying organisations should not be able to outsource to larger private companies/buying platforms when dealing with small business. This only enriches the middlemen, prevents barriers to small business and will not produce public savings or improve quality of services.
attributes.additional_details: The North East Procurement Organisation (NEPO) representing twelve local authorities and others such as Sanctuary Housing group has appointed a single private company called NEPRO which small business must trade through. This outsources responsibility to a private company, prices will rise to pay the middlemen, public money will not be saved. It is another barrier to small business trading with government. It is also bad practice as the middlemen can control trade and who gets opportunities.

attributes.action: Create a law that babies born prison should live with other relatives
attributes.background: Babies who are born in prison can't help it and should be moved to other relatives or adopted.
attributes.additional_details: Actually what inspired me may sound really cheesy, but it was Aerosmith's cover of Give Peace A Chance, with Sierra Leone's all-star refugees saying we shouldn't punish the kids for what they never did. Just like whether someone is black, or white, or Asian or whatever, they can't help it. And neither are kids who are born in prisons. Adults who go to prison KNOW why they're there and it's because they've done wrong (90% of the time), so I'm calling on David Cameron to create a law which means babies born in UK prisons are immediately taken out to live with other relatives in a stable loving home, or if needs be, adopted/fostered.

attributes.action: Limit council tax exemption to students housed in purpose built accommodation.
attributes.background: When Coventry planning committee agree another student accommodation development they quote that this will return a good number of current "student houses" back to use as family homes. To encourage this only students in purpose built multiple occupation properties should be exempt from council tax.

attributes.action: Plase let Second generations born outside the UK have British Citizenship.
attributes.background: Britain only lets first generations born outside the UK have citizenship. At least one more generation should be elegible like in other countries.
attributes.additional_details: Let a second generation be born outside the UK like when act 1981 was made for first generations by descent.

attributes.action: Make all drivers carrying passengers for reward take the DVSA Practical & CPC
attributes.background: At present it is optional if licensing authorities make new hackney/ph drivers take a dvsa test. I call for all drivers present and new of any licensing borough to ensure all drivers complete a dvsa practical, hazard perception & cpc. All other professional drivers have to and only equal they do to.
attributes.additional_details: Road safety is becoming harder to tackle across the UK, if we lead the way in Europe on how to maintain road safety by ensuring all drivers who drive for hire & reward take the steps as bus & lorry drivers have then we are one step closer to ensuring safety of passengers in any Taxi/PH vehicle & other road users for social, domestic, pleasure, commercial & business use too. Where the public are concerned this is vital for road safety and passenger reassurance that drivers are trained correctly.

attributes.action: Cut off all ties with Iran and cancel our part in the terrible deal immediately
attributes.background: The deal is a bad one, as everyone knows. It allows Iran to obtain nuclear weapons and missiles even quicker, thus endangering the security of Israel and the rest of the world. We want an end to this shameful and dangerous mistake at once.
attributes.additional_details: Obama lied about the deal as everyone knows.His clueless foreign policy is just to gain him anything of a legacy but he clearly understands nothing about the roots of terror and cares nothing about Israel's security. But our government should know better than to always bow to Obama. Phillip Hammond made a fool out of himself by trying to deny Iran wants to destroy Israel. Tony Blair and Gordon Brown would never have signed this deal and the Tories dare to claim they are more pro-Israel than them

attributes.action: Represent Wales in the Union Jack incorporating Y Ddraig Goch (The Welsh Dragon)
attributes.background:
When the Union Jack was introduced in 1606 its design did and still does today represent the four nations which make up the United Kingdom. 

However, it is only made up of three of the constituent countries' flags and we believe, in the spirit of the unity it represents - that should change.
attributes.additional_details:
Agnieszka, S. (2013) The Union Flag and Flags of the United Kingdom. Section Parliament and Constitution Centre, UK.

Cleans, G. (2007) Union Jack should include Welsh Flag, says MP. The Daily Telegraph, UK. 
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/politics/1570613/Union-Jack-should-include-Welsh-flag-says-MP.html

Contributors: Jacob William Billingsley, James Stacey Mayes, Patrick John Alderson, Ruari Iain Macneil

attributes.action: Automate all trains so there are no longer drivers or manual door openers.
attributes.background: It is ludicrous in 2016 that huge swathes of the country should be held to ransom by union action over something as silly as who controls the doors - personnel are paid far too much to press a button and move a lever. The technology has existed since the 70s to automate all of this.
attributes.additional_details: In 2016 Train Drivers hold the country to ransom whenever they want a pay bump, or even more favourable conditions. The average transport for London driver earns £55k, in the south, the average is £39k. No part of their job requires a human. It's time for progress, guarantee these people jobs until retirement, hire no new drivers - and slowly automate away the skill gap so that the current drivers don't suffer, but that no drivers can come along to make the rest of the country suffer.

attributes.action: "Parliamentary privilege" must not be used to keep members above the law
attributes.background: Despite having been jailed for fiddling expenses in 2011, a new CPS case of false accounting against sitting Tory peer Lord Hannigfield recently collapsed when Justice McCreath ruled he couldn’t be prosecuted for falsely claiming attendance allowance – on the grounds of “parliamentary privilege”!
attributes.additional_details:
This taints the reputation of both Houses, makes a mockery of reforms following the "expenses" scandal and sets the dangerous precedent of placing parliamentarians' expenses beyond public scrutiny or prosecution.

Therefore, we call on both Houses to debate and reform the practical application of "parliamentary privilege" in cases of prosecutable false accounting or fraud. Also, along with this, members subsequently convicted in the courts should automatically be deprived of their seats/titles.

attributes.action: Bring university fees down to £4.5 grand a year
attributes.background: People either can't or never pay the money if the government wants their money back they need to bring the fees down

attributes.action: Implement driving evaluations to make UK roads safer
attributes.background: Driving evaluations should become a regular requirement in the UK. By introducing a standard driving evaluation every 5 years (approx.) to deem drivers 'safe to drive', road fatalities and casualties should decrease, and the overall safety level of the roads should improve.
attributes.additional_details:
There was a recorded 24,610 people killed or seriously injured in car accidents between 1st April 2015 - 31st March 2016.

Motor traffic levels have increased 1.8% in the rolling year. It is important to ensure road safety is at the highest levels.

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/543662/quarterly-estimates-january-to-march-2016.pdf

attributes.action: Stop BBC Threats to Spy on all WiFi Connections, make iplayer Password Protected
attributes.background:
On 01/09/16 paying TV licence free is required to watch iplayer.

To enforce this BBC claim they've developed new WiFi snooping detector vans, to packet sniff all WiFi connections to see if iplayer is being used.

This is a gross invasion of privacy.  Not wanting to watch the BBC is not a crime!
attributes.additional_details:
The BBC already have access to the information of who is watching iplayer.  When someone watches their IP address is logged on the BBC server, which uniquely identifies which internet connection has been using it. 

The BBC have the option to make the iplayer password protected, much like Netflix or Amazon Prime.  This password could be associated with a TV licence, so only licence payers can use the service.

Detection vans are an unnecessary invasion of privacy & waste of licence payers money.

attributes.action: Allow fathers to stay with poorly babies in hospitals
attributes.background: on 3rd August 2016 my 4 day old daughter was rushed to hospital because she wasn't breathing properly, once we were seen we were sent to a ward, where I (Father) was told I had to leave her and go home because the ward was for women.
attributes.additional_details: I was forced to leave my baby in the hospital because they ward staff would not allow me to stay with her. I believe men should be allowed to stay with their children regardless!

attributes.action: To start the Tax Office and Government standard tax year from the 1st January.
attributes.background: The start date for the Fiscal Year of the 6th April was fixed when the UK moved to the Gregorian Calendar and is based on the antiquated "Quarter Days". Computers and Spreadsheets work best with whole months and years.  It is time that the Government Fiscal year is brought into the 21st century.

attributes.action: Make politics more inclusive for people with disabilities.
attributes.background:
I want to make politics and  careers  in local and central government more easier and accessible for people with disabilities and learning difficulties.
I would like to see more people with disabilities involved in policy making and government positions.

attributes.action: Make prisons rehabilitation centres to lower crime caused by released inmates.
attributes.background:
People who are put into prison are being released and causeing eaither the same crime or a worse one. 
Other countries have resorted to this tactic of instead of keeping inmates locked in like animals they give the a working environment where they can become better working citizens.

attributes.action: All petrol/diesel pumps must display taxes taken per litre and per gallon.
attributes.background: Most people aren't aware that the vast majority of the cost of fuel doesn't go to the oil companies who have to drill to find the stuff, transport it around the world, refine it, and deliver it to your local garage, but to the state that has done none of this.
attributes.additional_details: The sum of taxes should include VAT and the taxation of the oil companies and the garages or stores who provide the pumps.

attributes.action: Reduce university fees from £9000 a year to £1500 a year.
attributes.background: With fees being so high and possibly continuing to rise, the amount of students who are unable to afford further education is increasing, and any student who continues with further education will leave with at least £30,000 worth of debt, which they have to pay back with interest, which is unfair.
attributes.additional_details: Students have to pay university fees and living fees for the entirety of their stay at university which can range from three to seven years, possibly more. It is almost financially impossible for the average household to support this, even worse for lower income households. With the amount of students who attend university increasing (2015 recorded 532,300 students) paying £2000 each, per year should be more than enough to support universities, whilst being financially possible for students.

attributes.action: Stop the creation of retirement honours and dissolution honours.
attributes.background: Using these honours to reward friends and party backers brings the whole honours system into disrepute.

attributes.action: Make all pest problems the landlord or home owners responsibility
attributes.background: landlords and home owners should be legally responsible for all pest problems within the building and not just ones that transmit diseases.

attributes.action: Stronger convictions on burglaries
attributes.background: Too many criminals get away with burglary and many continue to reoffend. Preventing burglary is not enough, we need tougher sentences to reduce the amount of offences.
attributes.additional_details: The worst crime against working people is what we have earned and worked hard for is taken away from us.

attributes.action: Companies get tax benefits to sell recycled tech or parts rather than new tech
attributes.background: Every year, millions of tons of operational tech is thrown away. For example in Europe, the average phone is used for 1.5yrs before being swapped, but most actually last ~6yrs. If the tax system were changed, companies would be encouraged to promote reuse or recycling of old technology.
attributes.additional_details:
See
http://www.electronicstakeback.com/wp-content/uploads/Facts-and-Figures-on-E-Waste-and-Recycling.pdf

attributes.action: Offer discounted counselling to housing professionals.
attributes.background: The world of social housing is changing drastically. Everyday, housing professionals are presented with greater challenges due to welfare reform. While we are told to advocate greater mental health awareness, little or nothing is being done to protect those who work with most vulnerable in society.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to the implementation of reforms such as the benefit cap and universal credit, the already emotionally draining work of housing professionals is becoming more demanding daily. We must now delve deeper into the lives of our customers and often discover horrific issues such as domestic abuse, child sexual exploitation and even dead bodies in our properties.
To help our customers through these issues we must become heavily involved and yet many are not receiving the emotional support necessary.

attributes.action: Restore the Imperial system of measurment to the UK and phase out Metrication.
attributes.background: Metrication was forced upon the UK as a result of joining the so called EEC with those that resisted being prosecuted. Now that we are about to become a sovereign nation again and resume trade with many commonwealth and former colonies we need to return to what is a superior standard of measurement.

attributes.action: Change legislation for VED to weekly. DVLA gain 3 X payments every change.
attributes.background: Amend legislation from monthly vehicle tax to weekly. If a new car is bought privately that car will be taxed, and so will the buyers,neither transferable,but the purchased car will need re-taxed, in effect the DVLA are claiming three ( 3 ) times the duty on each car sold under these conditions.
attributes.additional_details: Currently if a car is legally taxed and driven on a road when it is written off or changed, the tax is cancelled, but duty paid for that month,a new car bought privately will be taxed also, but not transferable under current legislation.In effect the DVLA are penalizing motorists by raking in three ( 3 ) times the duty on each car sold under these conditions.Charging VEL on a weekly basis would be fairer, and as most transactions are made through the DVLA website it should be easy to change.

attributes.action: Levy £1.00 tax on non recyclable coffee cups and give proceeds to NHS.
attributes.background: Britain throws away 2 500 000 000 coffee cups a year which cannot be recycled. The technology exists to make them recyclable. This tax will make it an economic necessity for the BIG coffee companies to act.
attributes.additional_details: Reference BBC1 program presented by Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall "War on waste" 21:00 July 28 2016.

attributes.action: Employers should pay for staff to get home safe if they work past midnight
attributes.background: Employers should be held responsible for making sure their staff get home safe when working late shifts, especially young staff working in city centres. Hospitality staff in particular work late hours in at risk areas  & shouldn't be put in positions which make them vulnerable to attack.
attributes.additional_details: Working in hospitality for the last 6 years I've seen people been put at risk on their way home from work. Due to the nature of the job, working hours and the social climate within our city centres walking home alone can be threatening and potentially dangerous . Employers should value and take a degree of responsibility for the fact that their employees are looked after at all times - this shouldn't end at the door of work.

attributes.action: The UK to leave the EU Single Market by the end of 2016
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM government to respect the democratic will of the people and as such, make immediate arrangements for the UK to completely withdraw from the EU Single Market by no later than the end of 2016.

attributes.action: Stop banks charging,for IN THE RED on pensioners & those on low incomes,
attributes.background: Fed up on this action, continually in the red simply because of these £32 deductions!
attributes.additional_details: Now we are enforced to get paid by the Banks, this did not happen when we were paid by the Post Office, with our Pension Books

attributes.action: The government should raise the funding for music education in primary schools.
attributes.background: This government has cut funding for musical education in primary schools. The funding should be increased back to what it was in 2010 before the conservatives came to government. Despite Nicky Morgan's claims, music is a necessary part of education, and should be something no child should lack.
attributes.additional_details: To make a film better, we add music. To improve a dining experience, we add music. To make shopping experiences better, we add music. To make schools better, we take away music. This is wrong and should be undone. The government cut funding for a vital part of education for primary school children. These children now no longer learn anything in school about music: something every child should understand, at least on a simple level. The funding should be increased.

attributes.action: Invest more in our National Security to avoid an attack in the UK
attributes.background: Europe is getting unsecured. There has been terror attacks in the most important countries like France, Belgium and Germany. The United Kingdom may be affected in the future as well. We more security, especially on train staions, crowded places, Tourist attractions and big cities.

attributes.action: Switch the UK timezone to match the rest of Europe
attributes.background: The rest of western Europe has changed their timezone to UTC + 1 and since these countries are extremely close, it would be sense from a trade, enterprise and consumer point of view that this should be changed for the better.

attributes.action: Amend the planning rules away from favouring development
attributes.background: Developers seemingly put forward a massive plan for development and consult only a few neighbouring roads, plus put up a couple of laminated notices. Local councils can put out local plan consultations with no publicity. They should both be required to inform a far larger section of local population
attributes.additional_details: Planning rules seem to favour rich developers against local objections. This should be sorted so that development plans can no longer be released with minimal publicity and fanfare, and then developers or Local councils who want massive development to occur claim that minimal protest counts as approval for their plans

attributes.action: Place an additional tax of 10p a packet on chewing gum to pay the clean up costs
attributes.background: According to the LGA it costs £1.50 to clean a piece of chewing gum from a pavement. Not all chewing gum users are irresponsible about its disposal but it is wrong for general taxation to pay the clean up costs. A levy of 10p a packet (plus an explanation on the packet) will offset part of the costs
attributes.additional_details: The LGA estimate that it costs £60M a year to clean up chewing gum. http://www.local.gov.uk/media-releases/-/journal_content/56/10180/6745145/NEWS

attributes.action: Change the law, to give people in rural village communities the right to buy.
attributes.background: I’m living in a housing association home in a village I grew up in.The Housing (Right to Acquire or Enfranchise)(Designated Rural Areas in the Southwest) Order 1997  stops selling of right to buy properties in villages/towns with populations of less than 3000 residents it is unfair  on rural tenants
attributes.additional_details: My application to have the right to aquire/buy in January 2016 was rejected. I’ve written to and been ignored by my local MP for support and received an unsatisfactory reply from Brandon Lewis, Housing Minister at the time (Even though he agrees to the sale of housing association homes). My only recourse is this petition to get the issue raised in parliament and hopefully remove the 3000 resident  stipulation as the housing and planning bill including, right to buy is currently being considered

attributes.action: Enable transfer of pension funds to lifetime ISA for use as a mortgage deposit
attributes.background: I struck upon an idea where you could possibly transfer a stakeholder pension into the new lifetime ISA coming soon.  The idea would be to only allow for security against a mortgage.
attributes.additional_details: I would suggest that the transferred fund would be exempt from the annual government bonus but attract normal interest.

attributes.action: Compel Bacs to process payments over a maximum 1-day execution time
attributes.background: In 2007 the EU declared rapid payments essential for a modern and properly functioning economy, adding that there is no reason why payments should not be made by the end of the next business day at the latest. Why, then, nine years later, does Bacs still take three days to process payments?
attributes.additional_details: In 2016, 3-day payments should be redundant. For an electronic payment to take 3 days to process is unacceptable. A cheque which clears on the fourth day is barely any slower. And yet, Bacs is the only option for direct debits, the only RTI-enabled option for payroll payments, and the entrenched option for all other payments. There was no reason in 2007, and there remains no reason today, why all these payments should not be processed over a maximum 1-day execution time, by default.

attributes.action: Theresa May; Appoint a Minister of State for Climate Change
attributes.background: In Theresa May's first Cabinet appointments she abolished the Secretary of State for Energy and Climate Change moving the brief with Business. To ensure that Climate Change is at the heart of British politics we want a Climate Change Minister to work with all departments.
attributes.additional_details: Since the creation of the Energy and Climate Change department, climate change policy has largely been driven by using more sustainable energy sources. A new Climate Change Minister working in the Business department  could design new climate change policies that are not only just focused on sustainable energy sources. A new Climate Change Minister could be responsible for growing the green economy and encouraging corporate social responsibility.

attributes.action: Ban public transport peak fares, especially on suburban commuter routes.
attributes.background: The UK is one of the few countries in the world where commuter public transport users suffer a peak fare system, with transport often owned by foreign interests. Commuters are essentially being penalised and profited from unnecessarily as they go to work, often making car usage more attractive.
attributes.additional_details:
Budapest - 80p per individual suburban bus or underground journey any time of day 
Kuala Lumpar -  23p per stop on underground Metro (modern air-conditioned Siemens trains) any time of day
Barcelona - £1.80 individual bus or underground journey any time of day
Lisbon - individual journey bus on-board fare - £1.50 any time of day
Melbourne - all-zone 2-hour tram or bus ticket, £2 any time of day
Bangkok - daily any time Skytrain pass £2.60 (Bangkok is a very big city of 12 million people!)

attributes.action: Review British army prior Laser Eye surgery policy
attributes.background: Currently you cant have laser eye before joining the British army prior eyesight doesn't meet the minimum standards. As laser eye surgery makes you eyesight better why should the minimum standards before the surgery stop you. Why stop people getting Laser Eye surgery so there can serve their country
attributes.additional_details: "Spectacle or contact lens corrections must not be greater then -6 dioptres or +6 dioptres in any meridian." - Army Jobs "Laser Eye surgery or anything alike would not enable you to join as your prior eyesight doesn't meet the minimum standards." - Army Jobs.

attributes.action: Allow ALL tax payers to vote.
attributes.background: People who have no job and are claiming benefits but have been born in the UK are allowed to vote. People who were born elsewhere and moved here and are paying taxes and making a valuable contribution to the country they live in do NOT have the right to vote in the UK.
